stories.text:
Hey everyone,

Help me to understand is this one more crazy idea or is it worth making a prototype?

I think to build a device made from a universal IR controller and a camera that will detect the time of year on the screen (neural networks and so on) and tell your air conditioner to blow a warm tropical breeze or a cool north wind (not too cold for sure)

Any ideas are welcome.
stories.title: Storm Lord 3000
Forget the New MacBook Pro, Apple Has Bigger Plans
Epic Games Login and Rocket League Are Down
“Help My Roku TV is being controlled by someone.”
Light the Menorah on the Ethereum Blockchain
Nobel laureate: Mass vaccination during pandemic historical blunder

stories.text: Not asking for any specific tool, unless you've found a really good one. I usually measure progress for what I've done project/startup wise through startupschool.org that holds me accountable to those shared on it and daily check-ins with myself that I revisit weekly seeing what I did week over week. Wanted to see how you see yourself progress over time. Its awesome to see "snapshots" of your thought process in the past.
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you measure your own personal progress?
Free Markets Provide the Best Feedback
